cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn N-NW tonight, then N-NE on Wednesday, crossing Florida’s Big Bend Thursday and emerging into the western Atlantic Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between the Anclote River and Indian Pass

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass; Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to the Walton/Bay County line (Florida Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend) then inland across northern Florida and the southeast U.S. Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible; chance of tropical-storm-force winds remains low (≤11%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of southeast Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 5–10 inches of rain with locally higher amounts, leading to freshwater flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized street/urban flooding and reduced visibility could disrupt port and landside operations
